derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting the sending of the Holy Spirit into the world): from Latin missio(n-), from mittere 'send'

entry.tran: (尤指赴他国的)使命，重要任务
entry.def: A mission is an important task that people are given to do, especially one that involves travelling to another country.

example.ex: Salisbury sent him on a diplomatic mission to North America...
example.tran: 索尔兹伯里派他到北美执行一项外交任务。

example.ex: He has been on a mission to help end Lebanon's political crisis.
example.tran: 他已经被派执行一项旨在帮助结束黎巴嫩政治危机的使命。

entry.def: A mission is a group of people who have been sent to a foreign country to carry out an official task.

example.ex: ...the head of the mission in South Africa.
...a senior member of a diplomatic mission.

entry.tran: （军用飞机或航天火箭的）飞行任务
entry.def: A mission is a special journey made by a military aeroplane or space rocket.

example.ex: ...a bomber that crashed during a training mission in the west Texas mountains.
example.tran: 在得克萨斯州西部山区执行训练任务时坠毁的轰炸机

entry.def: If you say that you have a mission, you mean that you have a strong commitment and sense of duty to do or achieve something.

example.ex: He viewed his mission in life as protecting the weak from the evil...
example.tran: 他认为自己毕生的使命就是保护弱者不受邪恶势力的欺凌。

example.ex: There is an enormous sense of mission in his speech and gesture.
example.tran: 他的一言一行都带着强烈的使命感。

entry.def: A mission is the activities of a group of Christians who have been sent to a place to teach people about Christianity.

example.ex: They say God spoke to them and told them to go on a mission to the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere.
example.tran: 他们说上帝让他们去西半球最贫困的国家传播教义。

entry.def: A mission is a building or group of buildings in which missionary work is carried out.

example.ex: I reside at the mission at St Michael's.
example.tran: 我住在圣·米歇尔教堂的传道会里。
学校、修道院及其他布道场所

means.word_mean: 1. an organization of missionaries in a foreign land sent to carry on religious work
2. an operation that is assigned by a higher headquarters;

sentences.sentence: "the planes were on a bombing mission"

means.word_mean: 3. a special assignment that is given to a person or group;
4. the organized work of a religious missionary
5. a group of representatives or delegates

stems_affixes.word_buile: miss[v.错过;想念]+ing表形容词→adj.不见的, 缺少的
re不+miss送,放出,派,错过→不送出去→怠慢的
per始终+miss送,放出,派,错过+ive……的→始终放出→纵容的
sub在下面+miss放+ive表形容词→放下面→恭顺的
mission[n.使命,任务;使团,代表团]+ary人→n.传教士

stems_affixes.value_cn: 委员会;委任,委托[书],代办;佣金,手续费
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+miss送,放出,派,错过+ion表名词→共同送出[选出]的人→委员会
e出+miss送,放出+ion表名词→送出去
re再+miss送,放出+ion表名词→再次放过[别人]→宽恕
o出+miss送,放出+ion表名词→放出去→省略
per始终+miss送,放出,派,错过+ion表名词→始终放出→允许
trans横+miss送,放出+ion表名词→横着送出去→播送
e出+miss送,放出+ary人→送出去的人
sub下面+miss送,放出,派,错过+ion表名词→放下面→屈服

This year's shuttle mission is a big step in space exploration.
